00062 typedef unsigned char u8_t;

00074 /* Maximum timer interval for 16 bit clock_time_t */
00075 #define INFINITE_TIME 0xffff
00076 
00077 /* Clock ticks per second */
00078 #define CLOCK_CONF_SECOND 125
00079 
00080 /* Maximum tick interval is 0xffff/125 = 524 seconds */
00081 #define RIME_CONF_BROADCAST_ANNOUNCEMENT_MAX_TIME CLOCK_CONF_SECOND * 524UL /* Default uses 600UL */
00082 #define COLLECT_CONF_BROADCAST_ANNOUNCEMENT_MAX_TIME CLOCK_CONF_SECOND * 524UL /* Default uses 600UL */
00083 
00084 /* Use EEPROM settings manager, or hard-coded EEPROM reads? */
00085 /* Generate random MAC address on first startup? */
00086 /* Random number from radio clock skew or ADC noise? */
00087 #define JACKDAW_CONF_USE_SETTINGS               0
00088 #define JACKDAW_CONF_RANDOM_MAC         0
00089 #define RNG_CONF_USE_RADIO_CLOCK            1
00090 //#define RNG_CONF_USE_ADC      1

00092 /* COM port to be used for SLIP connection. Not tested on Jackdaw. */
00093 #define SLIP_PORT RS232_PORT_0

00102 /* Simple stack monitor. Status is displayed from the USB menu with 'm' command */

00105 /* RADIO_CONF_CALIBRATE_INTERVAL is used in rf230bb and clock.c. If nonzero a 256 second interval is used */
00106 /* Calibration is automatic when the radio wakes so is not necessary when the radio periodically sleeps */
00107 //#define RADIO_CONF_CALIBRATE_INTERVAL 256

00110 //#define RADIOSTATS 1

00112 /* Possible watchdog timeouts depend on mcu. Default is WDTO_2S. -1 Disables the watchdog. */
00113 //#define WATCHDOG_CONF_TIMEOUT -1

00115 /* ************************************************************************** */
00116 //#pragma mark USB Ethernet Hooks
00117 /* ************************************************************************** */
00118 
00119 #ifndef USB_ETH_HOOK_IS_READY_FOR_INBOUND_PACKET
00120 #if RF230BB
00121 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_IS_READY_FOR_INBOUND_PACKET()              rf230_is_ready_to_send()
00122 #else
00123 static inline uint8_t radio_is_ready_to_send_() {
00124         switch(radio_get_trx_state()) {
00125                 case BUSY_TX:
00126                 case BUSY_TX_ARET:
00127                         return 0;
00128         }
00129         return 1;
00130 }
00131 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_IS_READY_FOR_INBOUND_PACKET()              radio_is_ready_to_send_()
00132 #endif
00133 #endif
00134 
00135 #ifndef USB_ETH_HOOK_HANDLE_INBOUND_PACKET
00136 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_HANDLE_INBOUND_PACKET(buffer,len)  do { uip_len = len ; mac_ethernetToLowpan(buffer); } while(0)
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 #ifndef USB_ETH_HOOK_SET_PROMISCIOUS_MODE
00140 #if RF230BB
00141 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_SET_PROMISCIOUS_MODE(value)        rf230_set_promiscuous_mode(value)
00142 #else           
00143 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_SET_PROMISCIOUS_MODE(value)        radio_set_trx_state(value?RX_ON:RX_AACK_ON)
00144 #endif
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 #ifndef USB_ETH_HOOK_INIT
00148 #define USB_ETH_HOOK_INIT()             mac_ethernetSetup()
00149 #endif

00158 #define RF230BB_HOOK_RX_PACKET(buffer,total_len) mac_log_802_15_4_rx(buffer,total_len)

00173 /* ************************************************************************** */
00174 //#pragma mark Serial Port Settings
00175 /* ************************************************************************** */
00176 /* Set USB_CONF_MACINTOSH to prefer CDC-ECM+DEBUG enumeration for Mac/Linux 
00177  * Leave undefined to prefer RNDIS+DEBUG enumeration for Windows/Linux
00178  * TODO:Serial port would enumerate in all cases and prevent falling through to
00179  * the supported network interface if USB_CONF_MACINTOSH is used with Windows
00180  * or vice versa. The Mac configuration is set up to still enumerate as RNDIS-ONLY
00181  * on Windows (without the serial port). 
00182  * At present the Windows configuration will not enumerate on the Mac at all,
00183  * since it wants a custom descriptor for USB composite devices.
00184  */ 
00185 #define USB_CONF_MACINTOSH 0
00186 
00187 /* Set USB_CONF_SERIAL to enable the USB serial port that allows control of the
00188  * run-time configuration (COMx on Windows, ttyACMx on Linux, tty.usbmodemx on Mac)
00189  * Debug printfs will go to this port unless USB_CONF_RS232 is set.
00190  */
00191 #define USB_CONF_SERIAL          1
00192  
00193 /* RS232 debugs have less effect on network timing and are less likely
00194  * to be dropped due to buffer overflow. Only tx is implemented at present.
00195  * The tx pad is the middle one behind the jackdaw leds.
00196  * RS232 output will work with or without enabling the USB serial port
00197  */
00198 #define USB_CONF_RS232           1
00199 
00200 /* Disable mass storage enumeration for more program space */
00201 //#define USB_CONF_STORAGE         1   /* TODO: Mass storage is currently broken */
00202

00206 /* Network setup. The new NETSTACK interface requires RF230BB (as does ip4) */
00207 /* These mostly have no effect when the Jackdaw is a repeater (CONTIKI_NO_NET=1 using fakeuip.c) */
00208 
00209 #if RF230BB
00210 #else
00211 #define PACKETBUF_CONF_HDR_SIZE    0         //RF230 combined driver/mac handles headers internally
00212 #endif /*RF230BB */

00216 #define UIP_CONF_ICMP6           1

00218 #define UIP_CONF_TCP             0

00220 #define NETSTACK_CONF_NETWORK       sicslowpan_driver
00221 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_COMPRESSION SICSLOWPAN_COMPRESSION_HC06
00222 #else

00225 #define NETSTACK_CONF_NETWORK    rime_driver
00226 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */

00228 /* See uip-ds6.h */
00229 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_NBR_NBU     2
00230 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_DEFRT_NBU   2
00231 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_PREFIX_NBU  3
00232 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ROUTE_NBU   2
00233 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ADDR_NBU    3
00234 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_MADDR_NBU   0
00235 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_AADDR_NBU   0

00237 #define UIP_CONF_LL_802154       1
00238 #define UIP_CONF_LLH_LEN         14
00239 #define UIP_CONF_BUFSIZE                 UIP_LINK_MTU + UIP_LLH_LEN + 4   /* +4 for vlan on macosx */
00240 
00241 /* 10 bytes per stateful address context - see sicslowpan.c */
00242 /* Default is 1 context with prefix aaaa::/64 */
00243 /* These must agree with all the other nodes or there will be a failure to communicate! */
00244 #//define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAX_ADDR_CONTEXTS 1
00245 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_0 {addr_contexts[0].prefix[0]=0xaa;addr_contexts[0].prefix[1]=0xaa;}
00246 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_1 {addr_contexts[1].prefix[0]=0xbb;addr_contexts[1].prefix[1]=0xbb;}
00247 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_2 {addr_contexts[2].prefix[0]=0x20;addr_contexts[2].prefix[1]=0x01;addr_contexts[2].prefix[2]=0x49;addr_contexts[2].prefix[3]=0x78,addr_contexts[2].prefix[4]=0x1d;addr_contexts[2].prefix[5]=0xb1;}
00248

00250 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM        8
00251

00253 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_REF_NUM    2

00269   /* Network setup */
00270 #if 1              /* No radio cycling */
00271 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00272 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         sicslowmac_driver
00273 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00274 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00275 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00276 /* If nonzero an interval of 256 seconds is used at present */
00277 #define RADIO_CONF_CALIBRATE_INTERVAL 256
00278 /* AUTOACK receive mode gives better rssi measurements, even if ACK is never requested */
00279 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00280 /* Request 802.15.4 ACK on all packets sent by sicslowpan.c (else autoretry) */
00281 /* Broadcasts will be duplicated by the retry count, since no one will ACK them! */
00282 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ACK_ALL   0
00283 /* Number of auto retry attempts 0-15 (0 implies don't use extended TX_ARET_ON mode with CCA) */
00284 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    2
00285 /* CCA theshold energy -91 to -61 dBm (default -77). Set this smaller than the expected minimum rssi to avoid packet collisions */
00286 /* The Jackdaw menu 'm' command is helpful for determining the smallest ever received rssi */
00287 #define RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES    -85
00288 /* Number of CSMA attempts 0-7. 802.15.4 2003 standard max is 5. */
00289 #define RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES    5
00290 /* Allow sneeze command from jackdaw menu. Useful for testing CCA on other radios */
00291 /* During sneezing, any access to an RF230 register will hang the MCU and cause a watchdog reset */
00292 /* The host interface, jackdaw menu and rf230_send routines are temporarily disabled to prevent this */
00293 /* But some calls from an internal uip stack might get through, e.g. from CCA or low power protocols, */
00294 /* as temporarily disabling all the possible accesses would add considerable complication to the radio driver! */
00295 #define RF230_CONF_SNEEZER        1
00296 /* Allow 6loWPAN fragmentation (more efficient for large payloads over a reliable channel) */
00297 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00298 /* Timeout for fragment reassembly. A reissued browser GET will also cancel reassembly, typically in 2-3 seconds */
00299 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00300 /* Allow sneeze command from jackdaw menu */
00301 #define RF230_CONF_SNEEZE         1
00302 
00303 #elif 1  /* Contiki-mac radio cycling */
00304 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00305 //#define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         csma_driver
00306 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         contikimac_driver
00307 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00308 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00309 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00310 /* Enable extended mode with autoack, but no csma/autoretry */
00311 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    1
00312 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00313 #define RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES    0
00314 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00315 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00316 /* Jackdaw has USB power, can be always listening */
00317 #define CONTIKIMAC_CONF_RADIO_ALWAYS_ON  1
00318 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC_CHANNEL_CHECK_RATE 8
00319 
00320 /* Contiki-mac is a memory hog */
00321 #define PROCESS_CONF_NO_PROCESS_NAMES 1
00322 #undef QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM
00323 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM           2
00324 #undef QUEUEBUF_CONF_REF_NUM
00325 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_REF_NUM       1
00326 #undef UIP_CONF_TCP_SPLIT
00327 #define UIP_CONF_TCP_SPLIT          0
00328 #undef UIP_CONF_STATISTICS
00329 #define UIP_CONF_STATISTICS         0
00330 #undef UIP_CONF_IPV6_QUEUE_PKT
00331 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_QUEUE_PKT     0
00332 #define UIP_CONF_PINGADDRCONF       0
00333 #define UIP_CONF_LOGGING            0
00334 #undef UIP_CONF_MAX_CONNECTIONS
00335 #define UIP_CONF_MAX_CONNECTIONS    2
00336 #undef UIP_CONF_MAX_LISTENPORTS
00337 #define UIP_CONF_MAX_LISTENPORTS    2
00338 #define UIP_CONF_UDP_CONNS          6
00339 
00340 #elif 1             /* cx-mac radio cycling */
00341 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00342 //#define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         csma_driver
00343 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         cxmac_driver
00344 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00345 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00346 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00347 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00348 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    1
00349 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00350 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00351 #define CXMAC_CONF_ANNOUNCEMENTS    0
00352 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC_CHANNEL_CHECK_RATE 8
00353 #undef QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM
00354 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM        8
00355 #undef UIP_CONF_DS6_NBR_NBU
00356 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_NBR_NBU       5
00357 #undef UIP_CONF_DS6_ROUTE_NBU
00358 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ROUTE_NBU     5
00359 
00360 #else
00361 #error Network configuration not specified!
00362 #endif   /* Network setup */

00365 /* ************************************************************************** */
00366 //#pragma mark RPL Settings
00367 /* ************************************************************************** */
00368 
00369 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00370 
00371 /* Not completely working yet. Works on Ubuntu after $ifconfig usb0 -arp to drop the neighbor solitications */
00372 /* Dropping the NS on other OSs is more complicated, see http://www.sics.se/~adam/wiki/index.php/Jackdaw_RNDIS_RPL_border_router */
00373 
00374 /* RPL requires the uip stack. Change #CONTIKI_NO_NET=1 to UIP_CONF_IPV6=1 in the examples makefile,
00375    or include the needed source files in /plaftorm/avr-ravenusb/Makefile.avr-ravenusb */
00376 /* For the present the buffer_length calcs in rpl-icmp6.c will need adjustment by the length difference
00377    between 6lowpan (0) and ethernet (14) link-layer headers:
00378  // buffer_length = uip_len - uip_l2_l3_icmp_hdr_len;
00379     buffer_length = uip_len - uip_l2_l3_icmp_hdr_len + UIP_LLH_LEN; //Add jackdaw ethernet header
00380  */
00381  
00382 /* Define MAX_*X_POWER to reduce tx power and ignore weak rx packets for testing a miniature multihop network.
00383  * Leave undefined for full power and sensitivity.
00384  * tx=0 (3dbm, default) to 15 (-17.2dbm)
00385  * RF230_CONF_AUTOACK sets the extended mode using the energy-detect register with rx=0 (-91dBm) to 84 (-7dBm)
00386  *   else the rssi register is used having range 0 (91dBm) to 28 (-10dBm)
00387  *   For simplicity RF230_MIN_RX_POWER is based on the energy-detect value and divided by 3 when autoack is not set.
00388  * On the RF230 a reduced rx power threshold will not prevent autoack if enabled and requested.
00389  * These numbers applied to both Raven and Jackdaw give a maximum communication distance of about 15 cm
00390  * and a 10 meter range to a full-sensitivity RF230 sniffer.
00391 #define RF230_MAX_TX_POWER 15
00392 #define RF230_MIN_RX_POWER 30
00393  */
00394

00398 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_RETRANS_TIMER  10000
